channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for GA

item.title: Report E-2023100505
item.description:
Report E-2023100505

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-19T15:12:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-05
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 5, 2023, three (3) 1-gallon pails of UN1866 were punctured while in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel utilized all purpose cleaner and hand tools to remediate the resin solution-impacted dock door floor and trailer. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Qa was call over to unload due to a leaking hazmat. DescribePack: The hazmat caps were loose causing hazmat to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Qa clean the spill place hazmat inside a red tote to be taking over to the hazmat area to be process.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: CAPS OF BOTTLES BECAME LOOSE DURING SHIPPING AND HANDLING. BOTTLES LEAKED OUT AS A RESULT. PACKAGE SECURED AND TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT STATION. DescribePack: CAPS OF BOTTLES BECAME LOOSE. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: UPON DISCOVERY, PACKAGE SECURED AND TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT STATION FOR POCESSING.
